meanings.definition: Cause (an action or process) to begin.
meanings.sent1: The loud music catalysed the dance party.
meanings.sent2: The alarm clock catalysed her morning routine.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of cookies catalysed everyone's appetite.
meanings.sent4: His inspiring speech catalysed a wave of change in the community.
meanings.sent5: The bright sunrise catalysed a new day full of possibilities.

meanings.definition: Accelerate (a reaction) by acting as a catalyst.
meanings.sent1: The enzyme catalysed the breakdown of food in the stomach.
meanings.sent2: The heat catalysed the chemical reaction in the lab experiment.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rain catalysed the picnic to move indoors.
meanings.sent4: Her encouragement catalysed his confidence to soar.
meanings.sent5: The coach's advice catalysed the team's victory.
